description.narrative: This project is a joint project between the Uganda Girl Guides Association the Uganda Scouts Association and the Guides and Scouts of Finland. The overall objective in this project is enhancing gender equality in Uganda through supporting girls' education. Girls' ability to manage their menstruation during school days is connected to the question of quality education for all and thus to girls? drop-out numbers absenteeism and low completion rates. For example according to UNESCO estimation every tenth girl in Sub-Saharan Africa misses school during their menstrual cycle. This might equal as much as missing twenty percent of school days in a given school year. The niche of this project is in its ability to root the MHM as an integral part of the guiding and s couting programmes is Uganda. In addition to achieve the goal the attitude towards girls? education needs to be supportive. Therefore awareness raising in the society and advocacy are part of the project. By the end of the project equality in education bet ween genders has strengthen where the project is implemented and will continue and spread through the guide and scout pro-grammes in the whole country. The project uses the already existing guide and scout method and organizations to create permanent posit ive change in the society. The project is implemented in Northern and Western regions and it has 12000 direct beneficiaries and reaches 51000 net individuals.
